recipe.title: Pesto Quinoa With White Beans Recipe by Tasty

ingredients.ingredient: ⅓ cup ; olive oil, plus 1 tablespoon, divided ; (80 mL)
¾ teaspoon ; salt, plus more to taste
¼ teaspoon ; pepper, plus more to taste
15 oz ; white bean, 1 can, drained and rinsed ; (425 g)

steps.step: In a food processor, add the basil, arugula, ⅓ cup (80 ml) olive oil, the walnuts, lemon juice, ¾ teaspoon salt, the garlic, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and the water, and pulse until smooth. Set aside.

Heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes, until slightly tender. Season with salt and pepper and cook for another 2 minutes, until lightly browned.
Add the white beans and sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 3-4 more minutes, until the beans begin to crisp. Add the pine nuts and cook for 2-3 more minutes, until toasted.
Transfer the zucchini mixture to a medium bowl with the quinoa. Add the pesto and stir until well-combined.
Distribute the quinoa into airtight containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

steps_updated.steps_updated: In a food processor, add the basil, arugula, ⅓ cup (80 ml) olive oil, the walnuts, lemon juice, ¾ teaspoon salt, the garlic, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and the water, and pulse until smooth.
Heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes, until slightly tender.
Season with salt and pepper and cook for another 2 minutes, until lightly browned.
Add the white beans and sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 3-4 more minutes, until the beans begin to crisp.
Add the pine nuts and cook for 2-3 more minutes, until toasted.
Transfer the zucchini mixture to a medium bowl with the quinoa.
Add the pesto and stir until well-combined.
Distribute the quinoa into airtight containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.
